snippet: Lawmakers tussled with one another on Thursday, when a counterterrorism measure was passed giving more power to the security services and the president.
abstract: Kenya's Parliament passes divisive, sweeping counterterrorism bill backed by Pres Uhuru Kenyatta that allows security forces to hold suspects for nearly year without charges and eliminates many checks and balances on presidential power.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers tussled with one another on Thursday, when a counterterrorism measure was passed giving more power to the security services and the president.

headline.main: Security Bill Provokes Uproar in Kenya’s Parliament
headline.print_headline: Security Bill Provokes Uproar in Kenya’s Parliament

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
